alert.note: Alert for Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Berks, west central Montgomery and north central Chester Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pottstown to near New Morgan. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Birdsboro, Schwenksville, Elverson, New Morgan, Spring Mount, Cedarville, Gilbertsville, Stowe, Boyertown, Pottsgrove, South Pottstown, Amity Gardens, Sanatoga, Kenilworth, Halfway House, Flying Hills, Lorane and Harleysville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 302. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
